reviews.text: I had no great hopes of this B&B, as the tourist board website had very little information and it was basically a stopping off point to visit Newgrange. I was very pleasantly surprised!
reviews.title: Perfect for Newgrange
Memorable 17th Century Farmhouse
reviews.text: We had booked the family room (for myself and two teenage daughters) which is set up as a double room, which leads on to a small single, which leads on to the shower-room. It is spacious, clean, with very homely decor.

reviews.title: didn't have any trouble getting in touch
reviews.text: Jus twanted to add that I have a reservation there for the begining of August. I called a couple of weeks ago on my cell phone (T-Mobile, so I have international calling) since they don't have e-mail and got them on the phone after a few rings and they were very pleasant and easy to deal with; no twenty questions. sorry you didn't have any luck.

reviews.title: Good luck booking it!
reviews.text: Having read the great reviews for Roughgrange on tripadvisor, I tried really hard to book a night there during our trip to Ireland at the end of June. I tried calling them every day for a week at different times of day, but either it would ring on and on with no reply, or I would get a message that the number was 'temporarily unavailable'. I spent ages online trying to find a booking website - I eventually found one and submitted my reservation, but I never heard anything back, despite sending 2 chaser emails afterwards. I was still undeterred, so when we got to Ireland I tried again, I finally got an answer to the phone but the man was incredibly unhelpful, asking me a string of personal questions about who I am and where I was coming from before finally telling me they didn't have a room - all of which was quite aggravating when making international calls from my mobile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I never saw the place and I know several people have written glowingly about it, but I wouldn't want anyone else to waste so much time on such an unprofessional outfit. Perhaps it's ok if you're passing and they fancy taking a little business that day. Otherwise, go and stay at Teach Tailteann (aka Teltown House) instead, the woman there is LOVELY, with a beautiful 17th farm house and cute puppies to take you out on a walk.
reviews.title: The Last may have been the best.

reviews.text: My wife and I spent the last two days of our 19 day holiday in Ireland at Roughgrange Farm B&B. Irene is a GEM of a hostest and made our time very special. She went far out of her way to make us feel welcome and gave us a wonderful (very early) breakfast for our last day. I could not think of any other accomodation I would have rather stayed at in Meath. There is so much to see and do and no better place to use as a base for visiting all of the sights in the area. If Dublin is your choice for flying into or out of Ireland, Roughgrange should be your choice of accomodations.
reviews.title: RedBull X Fighters

reviews.text: A beautiful county home, immaculate bedrooms, supurb breakfast, and a huge Cead Mile Failte! All you could ever want!
reviews.title: A lovely spot in an historic area
